text: Palaquium thwaitesii is a species of plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is endemic to Sri Lanka. ==Leaves== Scattered, oblong-lanceolate-linear, tapering ends, lateral veins inconspicuous. ==Trunk== Young parts rusty hairy. ==Flowers== Solitary or 2's in leaf axils. ==Fruits== Ovoid, pointed berry. ==Ecology== Rain forest understory of wet zone. ==Uses== Wood - plywood. ==References== thwaitesii Category:Endemic flora of Sri Lanka Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Palaquium thwaitesii
